LIBRARIES IN ENGLAND TO 1850

This a complete listing of all libraries so far identified in England.

This is a large file!

The arrangement is by county, and within county by place and name.
HOME

BEDFORDSHIRE

AMPTHILL bed Giberne's Circulating Library 1773 [Daniel Giberne]
Northampton Mercury, 27 December, 1773.
AMPTHILL bed Literary Society 1845?
Slater's National & Commercial Directory, 1850.
AMPTHILL bed Mechanics' Institution 1850
1851 Census.
BEDFORD bed Archaeological & Architectural Society 1847
Correspondence, registers, library cat., accounts, 1847-1987. Catalogue: Bedfordshire RO.
BEDFORD bed Assembly & Reading Room 1845?
Listed in Kelly's Directory of Berkshire, Northamptonshire and Oxfordshire, 1854.
BEDFORD bed Barnes' Circulating Library 1805? [J. Barnes]
Northampton Mercury, 29 October, 1808. Succeeded by J. Bedford.
BEDFORD bed Bedford Reading Room 1825
J.H. Matthiason, Bedford, 1831, p. 169.
BEDFORD bed Bedford's Circulating Library 1809? [J. Bedford]
Northampton Mercury, 11 February, 1809. Catalogue: 1809.
BEDFORD bed Free Grammar School 1160
A.F. Leach, VCH, Bedfordshire, II, pp. 149-180. Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861. History 1925 BL 08364.g.26.
BEDFORD bed Grant's Circulating Library 1821 [W.P. Grant]
Northampton Mercury, 14 July, 1821. Catalogue: 1821.
BEDFORD bed Gray's Circulating Library 1829 [William Gray]
BBTI.
BEDFORD bed Independent Book Club 1820?
See R. Phillips, Personal Tour, 1829, pp. 17-18. 791.h.32.
BEDFORD bed Literary & Scientific Institute 1700
1851 Census. Listed in Kelly's Directory of Berkshire, Northamptonshire and Oxfordshire, 1854. Catalogue: 1892 - 11900.bb.76. Minutes, reports, loans, rules &c. (Bedfordshire RO).
BEDFORD bed Merry's Circulating Library 1825? [C.B. Merry]
BEDFORD bed Old Library 1700 [Bedford General Library]
The deed of gift reprinted by Thomas Fisher in Gentleman's Magazine, 1817, ii, 135-36, 578. Originally kept in the Vestry of St John's Church. Listed in Kelly's Directory of Berkshire, Northamptonshire and Oxfordshire, 1854. Bedford County Library. 550 survive.
BEDFORD bed Protestant Book Society 1790?
BEDFORD bed Reading Room & Library 1826
-1859. Minutes, catalogue (Befordshire RO).
BEDFORD bed Sharp's Circulating Library 1780? [George Sharpe]
BEDFORD bed Smart's Circulating Library 1753? [William Smart]
Northampton Mercury, 9 July, 1753.
BEDFORD bed Smith's Circulating Library 1791 [William Smith]
Northampton Mercury, 8 October, 1791. Succeeded by James Webb.
BEDFORD bed Town & County Library 1839
BBTI.
BEDFORD bed Webb's Circulating Library 1790? [James Webb]
1790?-1840? BBTI.
BEDFORD bed Webb's Circulating Library 1805 [James Webb]
Northampton Mercury, 9 November, 1805. Succeeded William Smith. Labels in Bedford RO; Franks; John Johnson. Catalogue: 1805. Label in Franks.
BEDFORD bed Wood's Circulating Library 1810? [John Wood]
Bill in Bedford RO.
BIGGLESWADE bed Free School 1557
A.F. Leach, VCH, Bedfordshire, II, pp. 149-180.
BIGGLESWADE bed Gardiner's Circulating Library 1839 [W.W. & C.T. Gardiner]
BBTI.
BIGGLESWADE bed Mechanics' Institution 1850
1851 Census.
BROMHAM bed Parochial Library 1740
Founded by Thomas Lord Trevor in 1740. N & Q, 1882,vi,258. Catalogue: 1961 - 2724.c.4. 860+ survive. Perkin's list.
CADDINGTON bed Caddington School 1666
Founded by Sir George Coppin. William Cowper was a pupil. VCH Bedfordshire. Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861.
CADDINGTON bed Parochial Library 1720?
All gone. Perkin's list.
CARDINGTON bed Parochial Library 1788
Bedford County Library. 157 survive. Perkin's list.
CRANFIELD bed Cranfield Book Society 1705?
SPCK Archives, 4 April, 1709.
CRANFIELD bed Parochial Library 1715
All gone.
DUNSTABLE bed Dunstable School 1200?
A.F. Leach, VCH, Bedfordshire, II, pp. 149-180.
DUNSTABLE bed Reading Room 1845?
1851 Census.
GREAT GRANSDEN bed Parochial Library 1793?
1 survives. Perkin's list.
HOUGHTON CONQUEST bed Free School 1632
A.F. Leach, VCH, Bedfordshire, II, pp. 149-180. Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861.
KEMPSTON bed Crowsley's Circulating Library 1839 [Samuel Crowsley]
BBTI.
LUTON bed Hill's Circulating Library 1825? [William Hill]
R. Phillips, Personal Tour, 1829, p. 7.
LUTON bed Parochial Library 1650?
Chained library. Perkin's list.
MEPPERSHALL bed Meppershall Book Club 1704?
Started by Rev. Thomas Salmon. E. McClure, Chapter in English Church History, 1888, pp. 271-2.
PODINGTON bed Parochial Library 1670?
Chained library. Perkin's list.
SHEFFORD bed Literary Institute 1845?
Slater's National & Commercial Directory, 1850.
SHEFFORD bed Stafford's Circulating Library 1839? [Charles Stafford]
BBTI.
STREATLEY bed Parochial Library 1729
A Bray library.
TURVEY bed National School Institute 1845?
Accounts & Papers. 1852-53. Education. 1854. Based on 1851 Census.
WOBURN bed Croft's Circulating Library 1839? [William Croft]
BBTI.
WOBURN bed Parochial Library 1670?
Chained library. Perkin's list.
YELDEN bed Parochial Library 1849
Founded by E.S. Buntin, the Vicar. 400 survive - Bedford County Library. Perkin's list.

BERKSHIRE
ABINGDON ber Belcher's School 1713
Founded by Richard Belcher. A.F. Leach, VCH, Berkshire, II, pp. 245-284.
ABINGDON ber Free Grammar School 1400?
A.F. Leach, VCH, Berkshire, II, pp. 245-284. History[1830] - 8365.aa.11(1). Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861.
ABINGDON ber Harding's Circulating Library 1800? [John Harding]
Catalogue: 1804 - Bodley. Bankrupt 1806. Reading Mercury, 18 August, 1806.
ABINGDON ber King's Circulating Library 1810 [James King]
Jackson's Oxford Journal, 14 April, 1810.
ABINGDON ber Literary & Scientific Society 1844
1851 Census. Defunct in 1851.
ABINGDON ber Parochial Library 1618
Chained library. Reading University.
ABINGDON ber Parsons' Circulating Library 1840? [Richard Parsons]
Listed in Robson's Directory, 1842.
ABINGDON ber Payne's Circulating Library 1825? [John & Charles Payne]
Listed in Robson's Directory, 1842. Listed in Pigot's National Commercial Directory 1830. Reading Mercury, 14 November, 1825.
ABINGDON ber Radley College 1847
(Archives)
ABINGDON ber Reading & Library Society 1810?
1812 MS Catalogue: in Bodley (Top. Berks. e. 1.)
ABINGDON ber Reading Rooms 1845? [Richard Parsons]
Listed in Kelly's Directory of Berkshire, Northamptonshire and Oxfordshire, 1854.
APPLETON ber Appleton School 1604
A.F. Leach, VCH, Berkshire, II, pp. 245-284.
BINFIELD ber Binfield School 1652
A.F. Leach, VCH, Berkshire, II, pp. 245-284.
BINFIELD ber Parochial Library 1670?
Chained library. Perkin's list.
BLEWBURY ber Blewbury School 1700
A.F. Leach, VCH, Berkshire, II, pp. 245-284.
BLEWBURY ber Parochial Library 1670?
Chained library. 6 survive. Perkin's list.
BRADFIELD ber Parochial Library 1800?
Perkin's list.
BRAY ber Free School 1705
A.F. Leach, VCH, Berkshire, II, pp. 245-284.
BUCKLAND ber Parochial Library 1660?
Reading University. 58 survive. Perkin's list.
CHADDLEWORTH ber Chaddleworth School 1719
A.F. Leach, VCH, Berkshire, II, pp. 245-284.
CHILDREY ber Free School 1526
A.F. Leach, VCH, Berkshire, II, pp. 245-284.
DENCHWORTH ber Parochial Library 1693
Catalogue: 1875. Ker p. 76. 150 (?) survive. Perkin's list. Built 1693 by Rev Ralph Kedden. N & Q, 1881,iv,304-05.
DIDCOT ber Parochial Library 1670?
Chained library. 9 survive. Perkin's list.
FARINGDON ber Knapp's Circulating Library 1840? [Richard Knapp]
Listed in Robson's Directory, 1842.
FARINGDON ber Knapp's Circulating Library 1814? [Richard Knapp]
Jackson's Oxford Journal, 16 July, 1814.
HARWELL ber Harwell School 1644
A.F. Leach, VCH, Berkshire, II, pp. 245-284.
HUNGERFORD ber Free Grammar School 1653
A.F. Leach, VCH, Berkshire, II, pp. 245-284. Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861.
HUNGERFORD ber Medical Reading Society 1825?
Taunton Courier, 3 November, 1830. Met in The Bear.
HUNGERFORD ber Parochial Library 1841
A Bray library.
HURLEY ber Parochial Library 1634
All gone.
LANGBOURNE ber Free School 1685
Schools Inquiry Commission, 1867-68.
MAIDENHEAD ber Literary, Scientific & Mechanics' Institution 1844
1851 Census. Listed in Kelly's Directory of Berkshire, Northamptonshire and Oxfordshire, 1854.
MAIDENHEAD ber Meggy's Circulating Library 1840? [W. Meggy]
Label in John Johnson.
MAIDENHEAD ber Spoore's School 1686
A.F. Leach, VCH, Berkshire, II, pp. 245-284.
MAIDENHEAD ber Wetton's Circulating Library 1811? [George W. Wetton]
-1822? Listed in Pigot's National Commercial Directory 1830. Succeeded by W. Meggy. Label in John Johnson. BL has imprints 1811-22.
MAIDENHEAD ber Wyvill's Circulating Library 1812? [R. Wyvill]
Reading Mercury, 8 August, 1814.
NEWBURY ber Andrews' Circulating Library 1820? [Jane Andrews]
BBTI. Berkshire Chronicle, 29 January, 1825.
NEWBURY ber Free Grammar School 1466?
A.F. Leach, VCH, Berkshire, II, pp. 245-284. Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861.
NEWBURY ber Fuller's Circulating Library 1788 [Benjamin Fuller]
Rules in BL copy of The Ramble of Philo, 1788, vol. 2. 1154.g.9. BL has imprints for 1796-99.
NEWBURY ber Harold's Circulating Library 1800 [Ann Harold]
Reading Mercury, 17 February, 1800.
NEWBURY ber Lewis' Circulating Library 1825? [Francis Lewis]
Listed in Pigot's National Commercial Directory 1830. Founded by John Lewis in 1795.
NEWBURY ber Lewis' Circulating Library 1820? [Winifred Lewis]
Listed in Robson's Directory, 1842. Widow of John Lewis. BL has imprint for 1841 - 701.c.38(4).
NEWBURY ber Lewis' Circulating Library 1795 [John Lewis]
Reading Mercury, 1 June, 1795. Succeeded by his widow, Winifred.
NEWBURY ber Literary & Scientific Society 1843
- 1904. 1851 Census. Listed in Kelly's Directory of Berkshire, Northamptonshire and Oxfordshire, 1854. (Berkshire RO).
NEWBURY ber Mayo's Circulating Library 1805? [Mrs A. Mayo]
Reading Mercury, 23 April, 1810. Died in 1822.
NEWBURY ber Newbury Book Club 1800?
Berkshire RO D/ENm2 C5.
NEWBURY ber Parochial Library 1695
Bray library. Perkin's list.
NEWBURY ber Roe's Circulating Library 1840? [William Roe]
Listed in Robson's Directory, 1842.
NEWBURY ber Willis & Fuller's Circulating Library 1787 [John Willis & Benjamin Fuller]
Reading Mercury, 3 September, 1787.
RADLEY ber Radley College 1847
A.F. Leach, VCH, Berkshire, II, pp. 245-284. (Archives)
READING ber Athenaeum 1842
Listed in Kelly's Directory of Berkshire, Northamptonshire and Oxfordshire, 1854. Minutes, accounts, &c. (Berkshire RO).
READING ber Beasley's Circulating Library 1826 [Ebenezer Beasley]
Berkshire Chronicle, 27 May, 1826. Succeeded - Mattacks. Succeeded by Richard Parsons in 1830.
READING ber Berkshire Athenaeum Club 1776
-1995. Minutes, accounts &c. (Berkshire RO).
READING ber Berkshire County Club 1776
-1887. Minutes, accounts &c. (Berkshire RO).
READING ber Binfield's Musical Circulating Library 1819? [- Binfield]
Reading Mercury, 12 April, 1819.
READING ber Blackman's Circulating Library 1772 [Samuel Blackman]
Died 1774. Succeeded by Mrs Waugh, sister of John Waugh, then her husband George.
READING ber Blue Coat School 1646
A.F. Leach, VCH, Berkshire, II, pp. 245-284. History, 1977 - X525/2190.
READING ber Brown's Circulating Library 1827? [John B. Brown]
Succeeded Knight & Dredge.
READING ber Carnan's Circulating Library 1780? [John Carnan]
Reading Mercury, 24 July, 20 November, 1780. May have taken over Newbery's library? Died 1785. K.G. Burton, Early Newspaper Press in Berkshire (1723-1855), 1954, pp. 104-11.
READING ber Didsbury's Circulating Library 1820? [John Didsbury]
READING ber Elkens' Circulating Library 1805 [John C. Elkens]
Catalogue: 1805, 1818. Reading Mercury, 6 May, 25 November, 1805; 2 February, 1818; 17 December, 1821.
READING ber Friends Meeting House 1825?
Catalogue: Reading,[1845?] (Friends House).
READING ber Grammar School 1138?
A.F. Leach, VCH, Berkshire, II, pp. 245-284. Bookplate 1746 in Franks.
READING ber Havell's Circulating Library 1818 [Edmund Havell]
Succeeded by Mary Havell in 1830; then George Lovejoy in 1832. Reading Mercury, 16 July, 1821; 25 November, 1822; Berkshire Chronicle, 23 September, 1826. BL has 1830 imprint - 844.e.4.
READING ber Jones' Circulating Library 1775? [Elizabeth Jones]
Reading Mercury, 10 November, 1777.
READING ber Jones' Circulating Library 1778 [T. Jones]
Reading Mercury, 12 October, 1778.
READING ber Knight & Dredge's Circulating Library 1823 [? Knight & ? Dredge]
Catalogue: 1828, Cambridge UL.
READING ber Knight & Son's Circulating Library 1812? [Charles Knight & Son]
Cp. Charles Knight, Knight & Dredge.
READING ber Knight's Circulating Library 1770? [Joseph Knight]
BBTI. Label - Forest Books, Catalogue 86, 1998, no. 89.
READING ber Knight's Circulating Library 1775 [Joseph Knight]
Succeeded John Samman. Reading Mercury, 3 November, 1777. Catalogue: 1777. Dispersed in 1780. Reading Mercury, 1 May, 1780.
READING ber Literary Institution 1808
- 1835.
READING ber Literary, Scientific & Mechanics' Institution 1843
Often confused with the 1826 Mechanics' Institution. Listed in Kelly's Directory of Berkshire, Northamptonshire and Oxfordshire, 1854. Cp. Literary Institution (1808).
READING ber Lovejoy's Subscription Library 1832 [George Lovejoy]
Succeeded Edmund Havell. Succeeded by Eliza Langley. Continued by William Smith & Son. Dispersed in 1928. Listed in Robson's Directory, 1842. Bodley has 1845 cat - Vet.A6.f.419.
READING ber Mattacks' Circulating Library 1820? [- Mattacks]
Succeeded by Ebenezer Beasley (1826); then Richard Parsons (1830). Berkshire Chronicle, 27 May, 1826.
READING ber May's Circulating Library 1800? [- May]
W. Childs, The Town of Reading, 1910, p. 3; John Man, The Stranger in Reading, 1810, pp. 111-17. Horniman's Reading Directory, 1827.
READING ber Mechanics' Institution 1826
Defunct in 1831. Revived in 1842-3.
READING ber Medico-Chirurgical Society 1824
Merged in 1899 with the Pathological Society. Royal Berks. Hospital.
READING ber Neale's School 1705
Founded by Joseph Neale. A.F. Leach, VCH, Berkshire, II, pp. 245-284.
READING ber Newbery's Circulating Library 1742? [John Newbery]
Moved to London; publisahed children's books. Cp. John Carnan and Anna M. Smart, who may have continued his library. Reading Mercury, 20 December, 1742.
READING ber Parochial Library 1727
9 survive. Perkin's list.
READING ber Parsons' Circulating Library 1830 [Richard Parsons]
Succeeded Ebenezer Beasley. Reading Mercury, 1 November, 1830.
READING ber Perryman's Circulating Library 1825? [W. Perryman]
Berskhire Chronicle, 28 October, 1826. Succeeded by Elizabeth Style.
READING ber Reading Book Club 1800?
Subscribers' list, A.D. Hendry, Three Sermons, Oxford, 1808. 1024.a.21.
READING ber Reading Pathological Society 1841
Royal Berks. Hospital.
READING ber Reading Permenaent Library 1807
Rules (1807) in Bodley.
READING ber Reading School 1750?
Lost in 1866.
READING ber Rusher's Circulating Library 1796 [James Rusher]
Catalogue: 1796, 1799, 1801. Reading Mercury, 21 November, 1796; 29 April, 1799; 3 August, 1801. Advertisement in Reading Guide, 1801. BL has imprints to 1815.
READING ber Samman's Circulating Library 1770? [John Samman]
Bankrupt in 1775. Catalogue: 1775. Berkshire Chronicle, 20 October, 1775; Reading Mercury, 27 November, 1775.
READING ber Sanderson's Circulating Library 1772? [John Sanderson]
Berkshire Chronicle, 18 August, 1775.
READING ber Smart's Circulating Library 1780? [Anna M. Smart]
Cp. John Carnan. Died 1809. Catalogue: 1782, 1783.
READING ber Snare's Circulating Library 1800? [Robert Snare]
Reading Mercury, 22 February, 15 March, 1802. Still going in 1827.
READING ber Style's Circulating Library 1830? [Elizabeth Style]
READING ber Waugh's Circulating Library 1780? [H. Waugh]
Hamlyn Thesis, 1948. ESTC imprints for J. Waugh from 1764; H. Waugh1787-91.
READING ber Waugh's Circulating Library 1774 [Mrs Waugh]
Succeeded Samuel Blackman. Reading Mercury, 16 May, 13 June, 15 August, 1774; 27 November, 1780.
SANDHURST ber Royal Military Academy 1801
(Archives)
SANDHURST ber Staff College 1820
Moved to Camberley in 1860.
SHINFIELD ber Shinfield School 1697
A.F. Leach, VCH, Berkshire, II, pp. 245-284.
SUTTON COURTENAY ber Parochial Library 1670?
Chained library. Perkin's list.
THATCHAM ber Thatcham School 1707
A.F. Leach, VCH, Berkshire, II, pp. 245-284.
TWYFORD ber Twyford School 1721
A.F. Leach, VCH, Berkshire, II, pp. 245-284.
UFFINGTON ber Uffington School 1636
A.F. Leach, VCH, Berkshire, II, pp. 245-284.
WALLINGFORD ber Free Grammar School 1659?
A.F. Leach, VCH, Berkshire, II, pp. 245-284. Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861.
WALLINGFORD ber Free Library & Literary Institute 1844
WALLINGFORD ber Mechanics' Institution 1849
1851 Census. Defunct in 1866.
WALLINGFORD ber Payne's Circulating Library 1840? [? Payne & Son]
Listed in Robson's Directory, 1842. BL has J.G. Payne imprint 1845 - 1268.h.20.
WANTAGE ber Coleman's Circulating Library 1845? [Mrs M. Coleman]
Listed in Kelly's Directory of Berkshire, Northamptonshire and Oxfordshire, 1854.
WANTAGE ber Grammar School 1598
A.F. Leach, VCH, Berkshire, II, pp. 245-284. History, 1924. BL - 08364.e.64.
WANTAGE ber Literary & Scientific Institution 1849
1851 Cenus.
WANTAGE ber St Katharine's School 1848
History, 1936 - 8365.aaa.42.
WINDSOR ber Brown's Circulating Library 1825? [John B. Brown]
Listed in Robson's Directory, 1842. Listed in Pigot's National Commercial Directory 1830. BL has J.B. Brown imprints from 1840 to 1857.
WINDSOR ber Chapter Library 1348
Do any survive?
WINDSOR ber Eton College 1440
A.F. Leach, VCH, Buckinghamshire, II, pp. 145-221. {Archives}.
WINDSOR ber Kelly's Circulating Library 1840? [Mary A. Kelly]
Listed in Robson's Directory, 1842.
WINDSOR ber Knight's Circulating Library 1783 [Charles Knight]
Bookplate in 1608/333. Adverts. in ESTC. Reading Mercury, 20 October, 1783. Succeeded by Knight & Son (1812), Knight & Dredge (1823), John B. Brown (1827). There in 1855.
WINDSOR ber Mechanics' Institution 1835
Defunct in 1861. Listed in Kelly's Directory of Berkshire, Northamptonshire and Oxfordshire, 1854.
WINDSOR ber Public Library & Reading Room 1845?
Listed in Kelly's Directory of Berkshire, Northamptonshire and Oxfordshire, 1854.
WINDSOR ber Style's Circulating Library 1825? [Elizabeth Style]
Listed in Robson's Directory, 1842. Listed in Pigot's National Commercial Directory 1830
WINDSOR ber Teede's Circulating Library 1839? [George R. Teede]
Listed in Robson's Directory, 1842. BL has 1839 imprint - 3434.aa.12.
WINKFIELD ber Winkfield School 1709
A.F. Leach, VCH, Berkshire, II, pp. 245-284.
WOKINGHAM ber Creaker's Circulating Library 1815? [Thomas Creaker]
BBTI. Reading Mercury, 16 October, 1815. Succee4ded by W. Gotelee.
WOKINGHAM ber Cruttwell's Circulating Library 1768? [Mrs Elizabeth Cruttwell]
BBTI. Died 1776. Succeeded by her son Thomas C. Cruttwell. Catalogue: 1768, 1772. Reading Mercury, 22 February, 1768; Berkshire Chronicle, 6 April, 1772.
WOKINGHAM ber Cruttwell's Circulating Library 1776 [Thomas C. Cruttwell]
Succeeded Elizabeth Cruttwell, his mother. Reading Mercury, 12 February, 1776.
WOKINGHAM ber Gotelee's Circulating Library 1830 [W. Gotelee]
Succeeded Thomas Creaker. Reading Mercury, 29 Marchy, 1830.
WOODSIDE ber Lending Library 1845?
Accounts & Papers. 1852-53. Education. 1854. Based on 1851 Census.

BUCKINGHAMSHIRE
ADDINGTON buk Parochial Library 1800?
6 books survive. Perkin's list.
AMERSHAM buk Cheyne's School 1699
A.F. Leach, VCH, Buckinghamshire, II, pp. 145-221.
AMERSHAM buk Free Grammar School 1620
A.F. Leach, VCH, Buckinghamshire, II, pp. 145-221. Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861.
AMERSHAM buk Harding's Circulating Library 1820? [Margaret Harding]
Pigot, 1823.
AMERSHAM buk Parochial Library 1744
Perkin's list.
ASTON CLINTON buk Parochial Library 1670?
Chained library. Perkin's list.
ASTWOOD CLINTON buk Parochial Library 1670?
Chained library. Perkin's list.
AYLESBURY buk Aylesbury Book Club 1822?
R. Gibbs, History of Aylesbury, 1885, p. 441.
AYLESBURY buk Aylesbury Book Society 1810?
Bucks. Chronicle, 30 November, 1822.
AYLESBURY buk Free School 1680?
A.F. Leach, VCH, Buckinghamshire, II, pp. 145-221. Recorded in 1714. Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861.
BEACHAMPTON buk Grammar School 1648
A.F. Leach, VCH, Buckinghamshire, II, pp. 145-221. Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861.
BLEDLOW buk Parochial Library 1670?
Chained library. Perkin's list.
BLETCHLEY buk Parochial Library 1670?
Chained library. 3 survive. Perkin's list.
BUCKINGHAM buk Buckingham Book Club 1790?
Subscribers' list, J. White, Journal ... New South Wales, 1790.
BUCKINGHAM buk Free School 1540
A.F. Leach, VCH, Buckinghamshire, II, pp. 145-221. Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861.
BUCKINGHAM buk Green Coat School 1760
A.F. Leach, VCH, Buckinghamshire, II, pp. 145-221.
BUCKINGHAM buk Literary & Scientific Society 1849?
Defunct in 1888.
BUCKINGHAM buk Parochial Library 1481
1 survives. Perkin's list.
BUCKINGHAM buk Seeley's Circulating Library 1755? [Benton Seeley]
Catalogue: Bodley. Several ESTC imprints 1751-88.
CHALFONT ST GILES buk Chalfont St Giles School 1789
A.F. Leach, VCH, Buckinghamshire, II, pp. 145-221.
CHENIES buk Baptist Chapel 1778
The Chenies Sunday School started 1840. An Inventory of Nonconformist Chapels and Meeting Houses in Central England. HMSO, 1986. Few books remain?
CUBLINGTON buk Parochial Library 1670?
Chained library. Perkin's list.
DENHAM buk Denham School 1720
A.F. Leach, VCH, Buckinghamshire, II, pp. 145-221.
FARNHAM ROYAL buk Farnham Royal School 1764
A.F. Leach, VCH, Buckinghamshire, II, pp. 145-221.
GREAT MISSENDEN buk Missenden Abbey 1550?
Founded in 1133. Library post-Reformation. Library sold December 5, 1774.
GREATLINFORD buk Great Linford School 1702
A.F. Leach, VCH, Buckinghamshire, II, pp. 145-221.
HANSLOPE buk Lady Pierrepoint's School 1721
A.F. Leach, VCH, Buckinghamshire, II, pp. 145-221.
HIGH WYCOMBE buk Book Club[or Reading Society] 1799?
Kaufman, Libraries & their Users, 1969. Gentleman's Magazine, November 1800, 1053. May be same as Wycombe Library, subscriber to G. Redford & T.H. Riches, History ... Uxbridge, 1818.
HIGH WYCOMBE buk Eedes' Circulating Library 1790? [Robert Eedes]
Label in Cambridge UL - Munby b.131.
HIGH WYCOMBE buk Friends Meeting House 1800?
Catalogue: High Wycombe, 1803 (Friends House).
HIGH WYCOMBE buk Fuller's Circulating Library 1774? [John Fuller]
Catalogue: 1774. Joackson's Oxford Journal, 2 April, 1774.
HIGH WYCOMBE buk Parochial Library 1849
A Bray library. 40+ survive. Perkin's list. N & Q, 1881,iv,327.
HIGH WYCOMBE buk Royal Grammar School 1550
A.F. Leach, VCH, Buckinghamshire, II, pp. 145-221. Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861. History 1962 BL 8369.tt.50. (Archives)
HIGH WYCOMBE buk Spicer's Circulating Library 1767 [Ralph Spicer]
BBTI.
HIGH WYCOMBE buk Wycombe Amicable & Literary Institute 1844
J.W. Hudson, History of Adult Education, 1851. Became the Mechanics' Institution in 1851.
IVER buk Iver School 1688
A.F. Leach, VCH, Buckinghamshire, II, pp. 145-221.
LANGLEY MARISH buk Kederminster Library 1623 [St Mary's Church Library]
250+ survive. Founded by Sir John Kederminster (d. 1639). Gentleman's Magazine, 1792, ii, 1181. Edwards, Memoirs.
LATHBURY buk Parochial Library 1650?
Chained library. Perkin's list.
MARLOW buk Cannon's Circulating Library 1820? [George Cannon]
Reading Mercury, 6 December, 1824. BL has[1850?] imprint - 3434.cc.50.
MARLOW buk Free School 1624 [Borlase's School]
A.F. Leach, VCH, Buckinghamshire, II, pp. 145-221.
MARLOW buk Literary & Scientific Institution 1845?
Listed in Kelly's Directory of Berkshire, Northamptonshire and Oxfordshire, 1854.
MENTMORE buk Parochial Library 1743?
Archaeological Society, Aylesbury. Most sold.
MILTON KEYNES buk Parochial Library 1670?
Chained library. Perkin's list.
MOULSOE buk Moulsoe School 1719
A.F. Leach, VCH, Buckinghamshire, II, pp. 145-221.
NEWPORT PAGNELL buk Abraham's Circulating Library 1813? [Miles Abraham]
Northampton Mercury, 24 July, 1813.

Subscribers' list to J. Wilson, Missionary Voyage, 1799.

CAMBRIDGESHIRE
BARRINGTON cam Barrington School 1719
Founded with SPCK. Ethel M. Hampson, VCH, Cambridge, II, pp. 319-355.
BASSINGBOURNE cam Parochial Library 1717
Essex University & Cambridge University. 800 survive.
BOTTISHAM cam Bottisham School 1730
Founded with SPCK. Ethel M. Hampson, VCH, Cambridge, II, pp. 319-355.
BRINKLEY cam Brinkley School 1722
Founded with SPCK. Ethel M. Hampson, VCH, Cambridge, II, pp. 319-355.
BURROUGH GREEN cam Burrough Green School 1708
Founded with SPCK. Ethel M. Hampson, VCH, Cambridge, II, pp. 319-355.

Founded with SPCK. Ethel M. Hampson, VCH, Cambridge, II, pp. 319-355.
BURWELL cam Parochial Library 1729
A Bray library. All gone.

Cambridge Chronicle, 21 November, 1807.

Minute books, 1853-1946 in Cambridge PL, 1947-1962 in Cambridge RO.

Rules 1823; Catalogue: 1825 - Cambridge UL.

Founded 13 July, 1833. Label in Franks.

Cambridge University.

Founded with SPCK. Ethel M. Hampson, VCH, Cambridge, II, pp. 319-355.

Westminster College.

(Archives)

(Archives)

Parker Library, 1575. MS. lists in Sears Jayne, 1983, pp. 78-79.
CAMBRIDGE cam Downing College 1800
(Archives)
CAMBRIDGE cam Emmanuel Coffee House 1763 [John Delport]
Had a library. C. Cooper, Annals of Cambridge, 1852, IV, pp. 328-9.
CAMBRIDGE cam Emmanuel College 1584
William Sancroft (1617-1693). MS. lists in Sears Jayne, 1983, pp. 78-80.
CAMBRIDGE cam Fitzwilliam Museum 1816
(Archives)
CAMBRIDGE cam Free Grammar School 1615 [Perse School]
History 1921 BL 08364.f.19. 1976 X529/31137.
CAMBRIDGE cam Friendly Society for Promoting Useful Knowledge 1784
Founded January 10, 1784 - printed label in Franks. Met at the Black Bull Inn.

Pigot, 1830.
CAMBRIDGE cam Gonville and Caius College 1349
MS. lists in Sears Jayne, 1983, p. 7.
CAMBRIDGE cam Goode & Hall's Circulating Library 1825? [J. Goode & John Hall]
Cambridge Chronicle, 27 December, 1822.
CAMBRIDGE cam Goode's Circulating Library 1815 [E. & J. Goode]
Label in John Johnson. Succeeded by Richard Harwood in 1822. BL hasimprint for E. & J. Goode 1817; E. Goode for 1819-20.
CAMBRIDGE cam Hall's Circulating Library 1825? [John Hall]
Listed in Pigot's National Commercial Directory 1830
CAMBRIDGE cam Harwood's Circulating Library 1822 [Richard Harwood]
Succeeded E. Goode.
CAMBRIDGE cam Hatt's Circulating Library 1811? [John Hatt]
Listed in Gardner's Directory of Cambridge, 1851. Listed in Gardner's Directory of Cambridge, 1851. Listed in Pigot's National Commercial Directory 1830. Cambridge Chronicle, 1 May, 1812; 30 November, 1821; 14 November, 1823. New library, 1823.
CAMBRIDGE cam Hobbs' Musical Circulating Library 1821 [J.W. Hobbs]
Cambridge Chronicle, 2 November, 1821.
CAMBRIDGE cam Hoop Tavern 1784? [Book Club]
Subscribers' list, J. Cooke, Voyage to the Pacific, 1784; also C. Collignon, Miscellaneous Works, 1786.
CAMBRIDGE cam Institute of Astronomy 1824
CAMBRIDGE cam Jesus College 1496
(Archives)
CAMBRIDGE cam Jesus College Book Club 1818
Jesus College archives - minute books. Still in existence? L.A. Pars, Transactions, Cambridge Bibliographical Society, 1970, 132-37.
CAMBRIDGE cam Jones' Circulating Library 1810 [W.D. Jones]
Cambridge Chronicle, 2 March, 1810.
CAMBRIDGE cam King's Circulating Library 1845? [Mary King]
Listed in Gardner's Directory of Cambridge, 1851.
CAMBRIDGE cam King's College 1441
George Thackeray (1777-1850). MS. lists in Sears Jayne, 1983, pp. 75-79.
CAMBRIDGE cam Magdalene College 1542
Pepys Library 1703.
CAMBRIDGE cam Marshall's Circulating Library 1791 [John Marshall]
BBTI.
CAMBRIDGE cam Mechanics' Institution 1835
Defunct in 1858. Listed in Gardner's Directory of Cambridge, 1851.
CAMBRIDGE cam Nicholson's Circulating Library 1752 [John Nicholson I]
1752-96. Hamlyn's Thesis, 1948. Succeeded Robert Watts, d. 1752. Nicholson Died in 1796. Continued by his son (John) and grandson (john). ESTC has several imprints.
CAMBRIDGE cam Nicholson's Circulating Library 1796 [John Nicholson II]
CAMBRIDGE cam Nicholson's Circulating Library 1815? [John Nicholson III]
Died in 1822. Library dispersed in 1822.
CAMBRIDGE cam Page's Circulating Library 1791 [William Page]
-1797. BBTI.
CAMBRIDGE cam Page's Circulating Library 1800? [William Page]
Died in 1804. Cambridge Chronicle, 7 June, 1806. Succeeded by his widow, Martha.
CAMBRIDGE cam Page's Circulating Library 1806 [Martha Page]
Succeeded William Page.
CAMBRIDGE cam Parochial Library 1670?
Chained library. 5 survive. Perkin's list.

MS. lists in Sears Jayne, 1983, p. 79.

Ethel M. Hampson, VCH, Cambridge, II, pp. 319-355. Founded by Stephen Perse. Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861.
CAMBRIDGE cam Peterhouse 1284
Andrew Perne (1519-1589). MS. lists in Sears Jayne, 1983, pp. 78-81.
CAMBRIDGE cam Queen's College 1448
Isaac Milner (1820).
CAMBRIDGE cam Seeley Historical Library 1807
Founded by John Symonds. Books added by Prof. William Smyth (d. 1849).
CAMBRIDGE cam Sidney Sussex College 1596
Samuel Taylor; F.S. Parris (1759).
CAMBRIDGE cam Society for Promoting Useful Knowledge 1784
Known as the Cambridge Book Club by 1813. Cambridge PL. Catalogue: 1796, 1813, 1838.
CAMBRIDGE cam Society for Promotion of Philosophy & Literature 1784 [Book Club]
Founded by Isaac Milner. Defunct by 1787.
CAMBRIDGE cam St Catharine's College 1473
Thomas Sherlock; John Addenbrooke; Thomas Neale. MS. list in Sears Jayne, 1983, p. 80.

1758-74. Also spelled Bulkeley. D. Nuttall, Book Trade in Cheshire to 1850, 1992.

CHESTER che Chivers' Circulating Library 1780? [John Chivers]
Chester Guide, 1782. Advertisement in John Johnson.
CHESTER che City Library 1773
Listed in Bagshaw's Chester, 1850. Ceased in 1857 - books went to the Mehcnics' Institution. Catalogue: 1774, 1826, 1835 - Chester PL.
CHESTER che City Library & Commercial News Room 1808
D. Nuttall, Book Trade in Cheshire to 1850, 1992.
CHESTER che Cowley's Circulating Library 1769 [Thomas Cowley]
Catalogue: 1769. Adams' Weekly Courant, 7 November, 1769.
CHESTER che Ducker & Bayne's Circulating Library 1849? [? Ducker & James Bayne]
Partnership dissolved in 1849. D. Nuttall, Book Trade in Cheshire to 1850, 1992. Listed in Bagshaw's Chester, 1850. BL has James Bayne imprints 1855-61.
CHESTER che Ducker's Circulating Library 1844 [Edward Ducker]
1844-49. D. Nuttall, Book Trade in Cheshire to 1850, 1992.
CHESTER che Dymock's Circulating Library 1781 [William Dymock]
Dispersed in 1782. Adams' Weekly Courant, 13 February, 1781; 29 January, 1782.
CHESTER che General Public Library 1817
Founded by F. Fletcher. Books bought by the Mechanics' Institution in 1835.
CHESTER che Hunter's Circulating Library 1844? [Elizabeth Hunter]
BBTI.
CHESTER che Huxley's Circulating Library 1850? [Benjamin Huxley]
BBTI.
CHESTER che Johnson's Circulating Library 1834? [John Johnson]
BBTI.
CHESTER che Jones & Crane's Circulating Library 1795? [William C. Jones & Thomas Crane]
Partnership ceased in 1797. BL has Jones & Crane 1796. Presumably Thomas Crane was son of T. Crane - BL imprint 1774. Cp. ESTC.
CHESTER che Jones' Circulating Library 1834 [Arabella Jones]
1834-44. D. Nuttall, Book Trade in Cheshire to 1850, 1992.
CHESTER che Jones' Circulating Library 1798 [William C. Jones]
Chester Chronicle, 5 January, 1798; 7 November, 1800. BL has imprints 1800-14.
CHESTER che King's School 1541 [Cathedral Grammar School]

Subscribers' list, R. Dean, Essay on the future life of Brutes, 1767.
CHESTER che Lomax's Circulating Library 1845? [James Lomax]
D. Nuttall, Book Trade in Cheshire to 1850, 1992. Listed in Bagshaw's Chester, 1850.
CHESTER che Matthew Henry's Chapel 1700
Matthew Henry was vicar 1687-1712. An Inventory of Nonconformist Chapels and Meeting Houses in the North of England. HMSO, 1994.
CHESTER che Mechanic's Institution 1810
Ceased in 1876. MS> in Chester City Library. Founded by John Broster; re-formed in 1835. Librarian Benjamin Huxley, 1835-50. Accounts &c. 1834-75 (Chester RO).
CHESTER che Minshull's Circulating Library 1783? [William Minshull]
1783-1801. D. Nuttall, Book Trade in Cheshire to 1850, 1992. Chester Chronicle, 17 April, 1801. BL has imprints 1799-1800. Cp. ESTC.
CHESTER che Monk's Circulating Library 1790? [B. Monk]
Label (BL).

BBTI.

Subscribers' list, C. Burney, General History of Music, 1776.
CHESTER che Parochial Library 1695?
Bray library. All gone. Perkin's list.

1808-48. Amalgamted with City Library. Catalogue: 1826 1578/6472.
CHESTER che Taylor's Circulating Library 1845? [Hannah Taylor]
D. Nuttall, Book Trade in Cheshire to 1850, 1992. Listed in Bagshaw's Chester, 1850.

TREGONY cnw Roseland Book Club 1791

TRURO cnw Cornwall County Library 1792
3,000 vols. by 1806. Ceased in 1920. Catalogue: 1794 (Bodley), 1856 (Redruth PL). Minutes &c. 1792-1921 (Cornwall RO).

TRURO cnw Harry's' Circulating Library 1772? [William Harry]
BBTI. Label in John Johnson. BLC/ESTC has imprints[1796]-1800. Sale of stock in 1816 - Royal Cornwall Gazette, 24 February, 1816. Succeeded by John Harry.
TRURO cnw Heard's Circulating Library 1812? [Elizabeth Heard]
She also ran a book club from her library. BLC has several imprints 1825-45.

- 1980. Records (Royal Institution).

Barry Mackay's file.
ALSTON cum Grammar School 1828
Rebuilt in 1828. Much earlier foundation? Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861.
ALSTON cum Literary & Mechanics' Institution 1828
Defunct in 1861.
ALSTON cum Pattinson's Circulating Library 1811 [Alexander Pattinson]
1811-61. Barry Mackay's file. Listed in Parson & White, History, Directory ... of Cumberland & Westmorland, 1829.
ALSTON cum Subscription Library 1821
Still going in 1860. Cumberland & Westmorland Directory, 1829.
ALSTON cum Tait's Circulating Library 1828 [James Tait]
Listed in Parson & White, History, Directory ... of Cumberland & Westmorland, 1829.
ASKHAM cum Parochial Library 1687
All 16 gone.
BOOTLE cum Bootle Chapel 1780
Few books survive. An Inventory of Nonconformist Chapels and Meeting Houses in the North of England. HMSO, 1994.
BOWNESS cum Parochial Library 1670?
Chained library. Perkin's list.
BRAMPTON cum Lancaster's Circulating Library 1811 [Henry Lancaster]
-1855. BBTI.
BRAMPTON cum [Parochial] Lending Library 1792
Bray library.
BRIDEKIRK cum Free Grammar School 1609
Schools Inquiry Commission, 1867-68.
BROMFIELD cum Free School 1612
Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861.
BROMPTON cum Smith's Circulating Library 1828 [Mary Smith]
BBTI.
CARLETON cum Carleton Church School 1710
History 1949. 08366.p.19.
CARLISLE cum Armstrong's Circulating Library 1800? [Miss Mary Armstrong]
Picture of Carlisle, 1810.
CARLISLE cum Beck's Circulating Library 1834 [John Beck]
1834-37. Also listed as Beek (error?).
CARLISLE cum Book Club 1768
Beckwith. Kaufman, Libraries & their Users, 1969.
CARLISLE cum Brown's Circulating Library 1848 [John Brown]
Barry Mackay's file.
CARLISLE cum Carlisle Law Society 1831
- 1941. Records (Cumbria RO).
CARLISLE cum Carlisle Subscription Library 1768
Listed in Parson & White, History, Directory ... of Cumberland & Westmorland, 1829. Merged with PL in 1896. Minutes &c in Carlisle PL. Catalogue: 1779, 1819, 1827.
CARLISLE cum Carlyle's Circulating Library 1800? [Robert Carlyle]
Picture of Carlisle, 1810. "drawing master & librarian".
CARLISLE cum Cathedral Library 1690?
(Archives)
CARLISLE cum Commercial News Room 1820?
Listed in Parson & White, History, Directory ... of Cumberland & Westmorland, 1829.
CARLISLE cum Fishburn's Circulating Library 1847 [William Fishburn]
1847-58. Barry Mackay's file.
CARLISLE cum Foster's Circulating Library 1824 [James Foster]
1824-61.
CARLISLE cum Grammar School 1541
Founded in 686 by St Cuthbert. Re-founded by Henry VIII. Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861.
CARLISLE cum Halhead's Circulating Library 1793 [William Halhead]
Died in 1798. Succeeded Lancelot Smith. Cumberland Pacquet, 25 September, 1798.
CARLISLE cum Jollie's Circulating Library 1780? [Francis Jollie]
Cumberland Pacquet, 14 January, 1783. BLC has imprints 1788-1826 .
CARLISLE cum Literary, Scientific and Mechanics' Institution 1825
Defunct in 1891. Carlisle PL.
CARLISLE cum Medical Institution 1824
Listed in Parson & White, History, Directory ... of Cumberland & Westmorland, 1829.
CARLISLE cum Parochial Library 1695?
Bray library. All gone. Perkin's list.
CARLISLE cum Robinson's Circulating Library 1828 [Miss Elizabeth Robinson]
BBTI.
CARLISLE cum Smith's Circulating Library 1791 [Lancelot Smith]
Bankrupt in 1793. Succeeded by William Halhead. Cumberland Pacquet, 10 May, 1791; 12 November, 1793. BLC has 1792 imprint - 1578/2950.
CARLISLE cum Society of Friends 1740?
Cumbria Record Office.
CARLISLE cum Somerville's Circulating Library 1823? [James Somerville]
Carlisle Patriot, 17 May, 1823. Pigot, 1828.
CARLISLE cum Subscription News Room 1820?
Listed in Parson & White, History, Directory ... of Cumberland & Westmorland, 1829.
CARLISLE cum Thurnam's Circulating Library 1816 [Charles Thurnam]
1816-52. Listed in Parson & White, History, Directory ... of Cumberland & Westmorland, 1829. Catalogue: 1823, 1827, 1831, 1835 (Carlisle PL). Run by the family until 1955. Library History, i/5, p. 170. There were Thurnhams in Carlisle to 1974.
COCKERMOUTH cum Bailey's Circulating Library 1805 [Thomas Bailey]
1805-24. Also had a library at Keswick. There were Baileys in Cockermouth to 1952.
COCKERMOUTH cum Banks' Circulating Library 1820 [Edward Banks]
1820-23. Moved to Carlisle in 1823. Fled to America. BLC has 1823 imprint - 1607/1119.
COCKERMOUTH cum Banks' Circulating Library 1800? [Edward Banks]
Cat.[1800?] (Carlisle PL). J.B. Bradbury, History of Cockermouth, 1981. Pigot, 1828.
COCKERMOUTH cum Cockermouth Book Club 1785
Merged with PL in 1904. Catalogue: 1791, 1794, 1819, 1847 (Carlisle PL). Cumberland Pacquet, 5 July, 1785.
COCKERMOUTH cum Cockermouth New Library 1810?
F. Jollie, Cumberland Guide, 1811.
COCKERMOUTH cum Cummings' Circulating Library 1784? [W. Cummings]
Died in 1786. Cumberland Pacquet, 12 July, 1786.
COCKERMOUTH cum Fidler's Circulating Library 1839 [Daniel Fidler]
1839-85. Barry Mackay's file. BLC has imprints 1857-85.
COCKERMOUTH cum Grammar School 1676
Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861.
COCKERMOUTH cum Hilton's Circulating Library] 1811 [Jacob Hilton]
Barry Mackay's file.
COCKERMOUTH cum Mechanics' Institution 1841
Defunct in 1899.
COCKERMOUTH cum Parochial Lending Library 1762
Bray library. For clergy only. Catalogue: 1815 (Bodley). All gone.
COCKERMOUTH cum Walker's Circulating Library 1786 [Robert Walker]
Cumberland Pacquet, 12 July, 1786. BLC has 1794 imprint for R. & P. Walker - 779.d.10.
CRAGG cum Cragg School 1744
Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861.
CROSBY-ON-EDEN cum Parochial Library 1687
All 16 gone.

Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861.
CROSTHWAITE cum Lyth School 1665
Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861.
CROSTHWAITE cum Parochial Library 1786
A Bray library. All gone.
CULGAITH & BLENCAIRN cum Free Grammar School 1775
Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861.
DACRE cum Dacre School 1749
Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861.
DACRE cum Parochial Library 1670?
Chained library. 1 survives. Perkin's list.
DALSTON cum Grammar School 1660?
DALSTON cum Kingsland, Dalston & De Beauvoir Town Literary Institution 1840?
Listed in Kelly's Directory of the Six Home Counties, 1851.
DALTON-IN-FURNESS cum Dalton Book Club 1764?
Still going? Kaufman, Libraries & their Users, 1969. Papers owned by the Club. James E. Walton, History of Dalton-in-Furness. Chichester, 1984.
DEAN cum Free Grammar School 1596
Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861.
DEARHAM cum Parochial Library 1685
All 16 gone.
DOVENBY cum Dovenby School 1609
Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861.
DRIGG cum Drigg School 1727
Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861.
EGREMONT cum Brown's Circulating Library 1843 [Isabella Brown]
1843-50. D. Nuttall, Book Trade in Cheshire to 1850, 1992.
EGREMONT cum Brown's Circulating Library 1848? [Elizabeth Brown]
BBTI.
EGREMONT cum Mechanics' Institution 1849
1851 Census.
GILSLAND cum Shaw's Hotel 1810? [John & Ann Bell]
In 1823 Shaw's was taken over by Elizabeth Hundspith. Carlisle Patriot, 1 June, 1822; 17 May, 1823.
GILSLAND cum Wardrew's Hotel 1804? [John & Ann Bell]
Included a library. The Bells also ran Shaw's Hotel, which had a library. Guide to Gilsland, 1804. Carlisle Journal, 31 May, 1806.
GREAT BLENCOW cum Free Grammar School 1576
GREYSTOKE cum Parochial Library 1650?

Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861.
IRTON cum Free Grammar School 1716
Schools Inquiry Commission, 1867-68.
ISEL cum Parochial Library 1687
All 16 books gone.
KESWICK cum Airey's Circulating Library 1811 [John Airey]
1811-29. Listed in Parson & White, History, Directory ... of Cumberland & Westmorland, 1829. Label in John Johnson.
KESWICK cum Bailey's Circulating Library 1809 [Thomas Bailey]
1809-34. Also had a library at Kendal. Listed in Parson & White, History, Directory ... of Cumberland & Westmorland, 1829. BLC has imprints for T. Bailey & Son 1842-45.
KESWICK cum Free Grammar School 1571
KESWICK cum Literary Society 1845?
Accounts & Papers. 1852-53. Education. 1854. Based on 1851 Census.

J.W. Hudson, History of Adult Education, 1851.

LONGTOWN cum Mechanics' Institution 1840
Defunct in 1861?
MARYPORT cum Kirkconel's Circulating Library 1823 [James Kirkconel]
1823-28. Barry Mackay's file. Moved to Workington in 1829.
MARYPORT cum Mechanics' Institution 1849
To date?
MAUGHANBY cum Free School 1634
Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861.
PARDSHAW cum Friends Meeting House 1815?
Catalogue: Cockermouth, 1821 (Friends House).
PENRITH cum Allison's Circulating Library 1820? [Joseph Allison]
1820-41. Taken over by B.T. Sweeten. Listed in Parson & White, History, Directory ... of Cumberland & Westmorland, 1829. BLC has imprints for[1800?]-1838.
PENRITH cum Book Society 1787?
Kaufman, Libraries & their Users, 1969. Wordsowrth was a member in 1787. Merged with PL in 1870s.
PENRITH cum Brown's Circulating Library 1809 [James Brown]
1809-37. Followed by Hannah Brown in 1837. BLC has imprints 1804-12.
PENRITH cum Brown's Circulating Library 1837 [Hannah Brown]
1837-67. Succeeded John Brown.
PENRITH cum Free Grammar School 1395
Re-established in 1564 by Elizabeth I. Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861. History 1963 BL 8360.b.2.
PENRITH cum Mark's Circulating Library 1785 [George Mark]
Cumberland Paquet - 3 May, 1785. Barry Mackay's file. Also referred to as Marks.
PENRITH cum New Church Library Society 1794?
Subscribers' list, W. Hutchinson, History ... Cumberland, 1794.
PENRITH cum Penrith Subscription Library 1820?
Listed in Parson & White, History, Directory ... of Cumberland & Westmorland, 1829.
PENRITH cum Shaw's Circulating Library 1812? [James Shaw]
Listed in Parson & White, History, Directory ... of Cumberland & Westmorland, 1829. Succeeded - Harrison. Westmorland Advertiser, 26 December, 1812; 9 January, 1813. Pigot, 1828. BLC has 1826 imprint - 10358.bb.31.
PENRITH cum Soulby's Circulating Library 1772 [Anthony Soulby]
1772-1816. 1797 imprint. BLC has imprints 17 97-1820. Barry Mackay's file. Barrow RO. Label in John Johnson. Catalogue: 1808 (Carlisle RO).
PENRITH cum Soulby's Circulating Library 1800? [Matthew Soulby]
See entry for Anthony Soulby.
PENRITH cum Sweeten's Circulating Library 1841 [B.T. Sweeten]
1841-85? BLC has 1885 imprint - 8228.k.14(2). Succeeded Joseph Allison.
PLUMBLAND cum Free School 1759
Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861.
SETMURTHY cum Parochial Library 1757
Bray library. All gone.

Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861. Newcastle University. Bookplate in Franks.

SPCK. All gone. Bray library.

(Archives)

WHITEHAVEN cum Boustead's Circulating Library 1820? [Elizabeth Boustead]
1820-47. Listed in Parson & White, History, Directory ... of Cumberland & Westmorland, 1829. Whitehaven Gazette, 31 January, 1820.
WHITEHAVEN cum Cannell's Circulating Library 1847 [George Cannell]
Barry Mackay's file.
WHITEHAVEN cum Corkhill's Circulating Library 1780 [James Corkhill]
1780-94. Barry Mackay's file. Succeeded by John Crosthwaite.
WHITEHAVEN cum Gaythorp's Circulating Library 1810? [John Gaythorp]
1810-55. Barry Mackay's file. Listed in Parson & White, History, Directory ... of Cumberland & Westmorland, 1829. Whitehaven Gazette, 31 January, 1820.
WHITEHAVEN cum Little's Circulating Library 1777 [Matthew Little]
1777-81.
WHITEHAVEN cum Little's Circulating Library 1781 [Mrs E. Little]
Widow of Matthew Little.
WHITEHAVEN cum Marine School 1822
Listed in Parson & White, History, Directory ... of Cumberland & Westmorland, 1829.
WHITEHAVEN cum Mechanics' Institution 1825
Refounded in 1845. Defunct in 1887. Whitehaven PL.
WHITEHAVEN cum Robinson's Circulating Library 1817 [John Robinson]
1817-34. Bankrupt 1834. Whitehaven Gazette, 31 January, 1820. Re-established in 1847. Barry Mackay's file. Listed in Parson & White, History, Directory ... of Cumberland & Westmorland, 1829. BLC has imprints 1821-38.
WHITEHAVEN cum Smith's Circulating Library 1803 [Mary & Jane Smith]
1803-20. Barry Mackay's file. Whitehaven Gazette, 31 January, 1820.
WHITEHAVEN cum Smith's Circulating Library 1810? [Jane Smith]
F. Jollie, Cumberland Guide, 1811.
WHITEHAVEN cum Society for Promoting Christian Knowledge 1793
Existed earlier, but re-formed in 1793. For Methodists. Rules 1793 (Carlisle PL).
WHITEHAVEN cum Stuart's Circulating Library 1820? [William Stuart]
Catalogue: Whitehaven Gazette, 31 January, 1820.
WHITEHAVEN cum Watts' Circulating Library 1835 [J. & M. Watts]
Barry Mackay's file.
WHITEHAVEN cum Whitehaven Book Club 1772?
Subscribrs' list. J. Priestley, History ... Vision, 1772.
WHITEHAVEN cum Whitehaven Library 1797
Bought by Town Council in 1921. Catalogue: 1797, 1798, 1801, 1808; numerous supps. Carlisle PL; Carlisle RO; Whitehaven PL. D. Hay, Whitehaven, 1979. Gentleman's Magazine, 1807, i, 77. Library History, 1969, 170-71.
WHITEHAVEN cum Younghusband's Circulating Library 1810 [Matthew Younghusband]
Barry Mackay's file.

Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861. History 1976 X525/2280.

1841-72. Barry Mackay's file. BLC has[1840] imprint.

1847-93. Barry Mackay's file.

Defunct in 1931.
WIGTON cum Parochial Library 1687
SPCK sent books in 1710. No books left. Bray library.
WIGTON cum Slater's Circulating Library 1828 [Jane Slater]
Barry Mackay's file.

Barry MAckay's file.

WORKINGTON cum Borrowdale's Circulating Library 1802 [William Borrowdale]
1802-42. Cumberland Pacquet, 14 May, 1805. BLC has 1805 imprint.
WORKINGTON cum Dixon's Circulating Library 1818 [William Dixon]
1818-55. Barry Mackay's file. Cumberland Pacquet, 29 September, 1818. BLC has[1820] imprint.
WORKINGTON cum Eckford's Circulating Library 1777 [William Eckford]
Died 1799. Cumberland Pacquet, 21 October, 1777; 13 August, 1799. His widow, Mary, took over his business, but no references to her running a circulating library.
WORKINGTON cum Free School 1664
Schools Inquiry Commission, 1867-68.
WORKINGTON cum Kirkconel's Circulating Library 1829 [James Kirkconel]
Moved in 1829 from Maryport. 1829-47. Barry Mackay's file.
WORKINGTON cum McGar's Circulating Library 1847 [James McGar]
1847-61. Barry MAckay's file.
WORKINGTON cum Mordy's Circulating Library 1820? [Robert Mordy]
BBTI. BLC has 1821 imprint.
WORKINGTON cum Richardson's Circulating Library 1796 [John Richardson]
1796-98. Barry Mackay's file. Newcastle Chronicle, 11 june, 1796. Cumberland Pacquet, 19 April, 1796. Sold in 1798 - Cumberland Pacquet, 24 April, 1798. BLC has 1797 imprint - 12512.aa.16.
WORKINGTON cum Thompson's Circulating Library 1820? [Wilson Thompson]
Catalogue: 1821 (Carlisle PL).
WORKINGTON cum Workington Subscription Library 1803
Catalogue: 1824 (Carlisle PL).
WREAY cum Free School 1540?
WYTHOP cum Parochial Library 1757
Bray library.

DERBYSHIRE

ALFRETON der Alfreton Circulating Library 1810? [? ?]
Adv. for sale in 1824. Unknown owner. Sheffield Mercury, 28 February, 1824.

A.F. Leach, VCH, Derbyshire, II, pp. 207-281. Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861.

Listed in Bagshaw's Directory of Derbyshire, 1846.

Listed in Bagshaw's Directory of Derbyshire, 1846.

-1853. Proceedings (Derbyshire RO).

BUXTON der Moore's Circulating Library 1799? [William Moore I]
Listed in Bagshaw's Directory of Derbyshire, 1846. Listed in Pigot's Commercial Directory for Derbyshire, 1835. Also had a newsroom.

CHESTERFIELD der Bennett's Circulating Library 1826 [Thomas Bennett]
BBTI.
CHESTERFIELD der Callow's Circulating Library 1785? [John Callow]
Died in 1800. Succeeded by John T. Saxton. Label (BL).
CHESTERFIELD der Calton's Circulating Library 1775? [- Calton]
Succeeded by Thomas White.
CHESTERFIELD der Chesterfield & Brampton Mechanics' Institution 1841
Defunct in 1880. Minutes 1841-1880 (Derbyshire RO).
CHESTERFIELD der Chesterfield Book Society 1815
Catalogue: 1815, 1827 (Derby PL) - 1,000+ vols. Derbyshire Courier, 18 February, 1843. Library History, vi,2, p. 30.
CHESTERFIELD der Chesterfield Library 1791
BBTI. Still going in 1857. History of Chesterfield, 1839.
CHESTERFIELD der Clarke's School 1690
Founded by Cornelius Clarke. A.F. Leach, VCH, Derbyshire, II, pp. 207-281.
CHESTERFIELD der Dissenting Chapel Library 1800?
Subscribers' list, J. Toulmin, Historical View ... Dissenters, 1814.
CHESTERFIELD der Ford's Circulating Library 1808? [John Ford]
Succeeded Thomas White. Derby Mercury, 20 August, 1801. BLC has 1821 imprint - 7938.aa.38.
CHESTERFIELD der Free Grammar School 1336?
A.F. Leach, VCH, Derbyshire, II, pp. 207-281. Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861.
CHESTERFIELD der Friends Meeting House 1770+
Demolished 1974. Had a library. An Inventory of Nonconformist Chapels and Meeting Houses in Central England. HMSO, 1986.
CHESTERFIELD der Gallimore's Circulating Library 1840? [Cornelius Gallimore]
Listed in Bagshaw's Directory of Derbyshire, 1846. BLC has 2 imprints, 1844 and[1847?].
CHESTERFIELD der Griffith's Circulating Library 1846 [Jeffreys Griffith]
BBTI.
CHESTERFIELD der Mechanics' Institution 1827
Derby PL. Minutes 1841-80 (Derbyshire RO).
CHESTERFIELD der News Room 1845?
Slater's National & Commercial Directory, 1850.
CHESTERFIELD der Roberts' Circulating Library 1821 [John Roberts]
-1852. BBTI. BLC has[1837] imprint - 908.d.15(9).
CHESTERFIELD der Saxton's Circulating Library 1800 [John T. Saxton]
Succeeded John Calow. Catalogue: 1789, 1801. Sheffield Register, 23 may, 1789; Derby Mercury, 20 August, 1801.
CHESTERFIELD der White's Circulating Library 1780? [Thomas White]
Derby Mercury, 3 April, 1783. Succeeded - Calton.

A.F. Leach, VCH, Derbyshire, II, pp. 207-281.

CROMFORD der [Literary & Scientific Institution?] 1845?
Listed in the 1849 Public Library Report (p.317) lacking authentic information. Not yet identified.
DENBY der Denby School 1728
A.F. Leach, VCH, Derbyshire, II, pp. 207-281.
DERBY der Avery's Circulating Library 1831 [Sarah Avery]
-1843. BBTI. Succeeded by Columbell.
DERBY der Bailey's Circulating Library 1842 [Edward Bailey]
-1848. BBTI.
DERBY der Bemrose's Circulating Library 1828 [William Bemrose]
H.H. Bemrose, House of Bemrose, 1926.
DERBY der Bemrose's News Room 1820? [Bemrose & Co.]
Listed in Glover's Directory of Derby, 1829.
DERBY der Bretnor's Circulating Library 1830? [William Bretnor]
Listed in Pigot's Commercial Directory for Derbyshire, 1835.
DERBY der Collumbell's Circulating Library 1845? [Sarah & Elizabeth Collumbell]
Catalogue: 1845 - Derby PL. Library History, vi/2, p. 30. Listed in Bagshaw's Directory of Derbyshire, 1846. Slater's National & Commercial Directory, 1850. L Greaves, The Circulating Libraries of Derby, 1757-1871. 1966.
DERBY der Derby Assembly Rooms 1763
Papers 1829-42 (Private owner) - NRA 618. When were books provided?
DERBY der Derby Book Club 1750?
Adv. for sale in 1753 - Derby Mercury, 4 May, 1753.
DERBY der Derby Book Society 1757?
Kaufman, Libraries & their Users, 1969. Rules (Debry PL). Several subscribers' lists.
DERBY der Derby County Book Society 1755?
Subscribers' list, S. Ockley, History of the saracens, 1757.
DERBY der Dewar's Circulating Library 1846 [David Dewar]
BBTI.
DERBY der Drewry's Book Society 1790? [John Drewry]
Pigot, 1822. BLC has imprints 1789-1832.
DERBY der Fox's Circulating Library 1764? [Samuel Fox]
Died 1770. L. Greaves, Circulating Libraries of Derby, FLA, 1966. R.P. Sturges, Library History, 1976, pp. 44-52. BLC has 1766 imprint - 1651/2169.
DERBY der Free Grammar School 1160?
A.F. Leach, VCH, Derbyshire, II, pp. 207-281. Founded in 1160; re-founded 1554. Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861. History 1954 08368.cc.38.
DERBY der Friar Gate Chapel Library 1816
Also a Sunday School. Catalogue: 1816, 1836 (Sunday School), 1845 (Derby PL). Library History, vi,2, p. 30.
DERBY der Frost & Locker's Circulating Library 1845? [? Frost & ? Locker]
Slater's National & Commercial Directory, 1850.
DERBY der Hewitt's Circulating Library 1830?
Catalogue: 1852 - Derby PL. Library History, vi/2, p. 30.
DERBY der Hill's Circulating Library 1840? [John Hill]
1842. BBTI. Listed in Bagshaw's Directory of Derbyshire, 1846.
DERBY der Hobson's Circulating Library 1842? [William Hobson]
Listed in Bagshaw's Directory of Derbyshire, 1846. Slater's National & Commercial Directory, 1850.
DERBY der Holmes & Edwards Circulating Library 1825 [? Holmes & ? Edwards]
L. Greaves, Circulating Libraries of Derby, FLA, 1966. R.P Sturges, Library History, 1976, pp. 44-52.
DERBY der Holy Trinity[Parochial] Library 1840?
Lending library. Perkin's list.
DERBY der Horsley's Circulating Library 1830? [William Horsley]
BBTI. Slater's National & Commercial Directory, 1850. BLC has 1832 imprint - 4136.c.8(1).
DERBY der Johnson's Circulating Library 1812 [John Johnson]
Derby Mercury, 17 December, 1812.
DERBY der Locker's Circulating Library 1840? [Joseph Locker]
Listed in Bagshaw's Directory of Derbyshire, 1846.
DERBY der Locker's Circulating Library 1848 [Mrs Lydia Locker]
BBTI.
DERBY der Marriott's Circulating Library 1796 [William Marriott]
Died 1818. Succeeded John Sanders II. L. Greaves, Circulating Libraries of Derby, FLA, 1966. R.P Sturges, Library History, 1976, pp. 44-52. Catalogue: 1795. Library History, vi,2, p. 31. BLC has 1803 imprint - 1570/5244.
DERBY der Mechanics' Institution 1825
Catalogue: 1834, 1836, 1841, 1845, 1848, 1851, 1856 - Derby PL. Defunct in 1915? Listed in Glover's Directory of Derby, 1829. Records 1825-1915 (Derby PL).
DERBY der News Room 1820?
Listed in Glover's Directory of Derby, 1829.
DERBY der Ordoyno's Circulating Library 1791 [Charles S. Ordoyno]
L. Greaves, Circulating Libraries of Derby, FLA, 1966. R.P Sturges, Library History, 1976, pp. 44-52. Derby Mercury, 14 July, 1791.
DERBY der Permanent Library 1811
Listed in Glover's Directory of Derby, 1829. Merged with Town & Country Library in 1835. Catalogue: 1811, 1819, 1835 (Derby PL). Library History, vi,2, p. 34.
DERBY der Philosophical Library 1784
Listed in Glover's Directory of Derby, 1829. MS Catalogue: 1784 Derby PL. Catalogue: 1798, 1815, 1835 (Derby PL).
DERBY der Philosophical Society 1787
-1845. Records (Derby PL).
DERBY der Pritchard's New Book Society 1792? [William Pritchard]
Rules in S.S. Banks collection (BL). Met at the Talbot Inn.
DERBY der Richardson & Handford's Circulating Library 1818 [Thomas Richardson & Harper Handford]
-1826. BBTI. 2,400 vols. by 1821. Derby Mercury, 21 November, 1821. Bankrupt in 1826. Succeeded, after Holmes & Edwards, by William Bemrose. BLC has several imprints for Richardson 1820-42, none for Handford.
DERBY der Roome's Book Society 1780? [Francis Roome]
Roome died in 1812. BLC has 1781 imrpint.
DERBY der Sanders' Circulating Library 1757 [John Sanders I]
Died 1771? Derby Mercury, 2 December, 1757 Catalogue: 1766 - Derby Mercury, 8 August, 1766. Catalogue: 1771 (Derby PL). Succeeded by his son John. L. Greaves, Circulating Libraries of Derby, FLA, 1966. R.P Sturges, Library History, 1976, pp. 44-52.
DERBY der Sanders' Circulating Library 1771? [John Sanders II]
Ceased in 1799. Catalogue: 1771, 1777 (Derby PL). L. Greaves, Circulating Libraries of Derby, FLA, 1966. R.P Sturges, Library History, 1976, pp. 44-52. BLC has 1776 imprint - 1609/270.
DERBY der Smith's Circulating Library 1845? [John Smith]
Slater's National & Commercial Directory, 1850.
DERBY der St John's[Parochial] Library 1840?
Lending library. Perkin's list.
DERBY der St Peter's[Parochial] Library 1850
Lending library. Perkin's list.
DERBY der Stenson's Circulating Library 1800? [Thomas Stenson]
Derby Mercury, 19 February, 1801; 16 April, 1801. Died 1805. Succeeded by his widow, Ann.
DERBY der Stenson's Circulating Library 1805 [Ann Stenson]
Succeeded by John W. Stenson. 5000 vols. by 1808. Derby Mercury, 1 December, 1808.
DERBY der Stenson's Circulating Library 1823? [John W. Stenson]
Catalogue: 1811. - 1850.
DERBY der Toplis' Circulating Library 1845? [Joseph Toplis]
Listed in Bagshaw's Directory of Derbyshire, 1846.
DERBY der Town & County Library 1835 [Edward Bailey]
Catalogue: 1835. Library History, vi/2, p. 31. Listed in Bagshaw's Directory of Derbyshire, 1846. Papers in Derby PL (1835-69).
DERBY der Trinity Church 1845?
Catalogue: 1849, 1855 (Derby PL).
DERBY der Union Book Society 1784
Kaufman, Libraries & their Users, 1969. Label in John Johnson.
DERBY der Unitarian Chapel 1840?
Catalogue: Sunday School Library 1845 (Derby PL).
DERBY der Wesleyan Library 1840? [William Horsley]
Listed in Bagshaw's Directory of Derbyshire, 1846.
DERBY der Wesleyan Methodist Sabbath School 1850?
Catalogue: 1852, 1855 (Derby PL).
DERBY der Wilkins' Circulating Library 1801 [George Wilkins]
Catalogue: 1802, Derby Mercury, 28 January, 1802; 1813, Derby Mercury, 19 August, 1813.Succeeded by son, William. Catalogue: 1817 (Derby PL). Derby Mercury, 20 September, 1804; 19 April, 1809; 26 August, 1813; 23 November, 1815; 6 December, 1820. BLC has imprints[1800]-1820. Wilkins was librarian to the Derby Permanent Library.
DERBY der Wilkins' Circulating Library 1848 [William Wilkins]

Defunct in 1837.

Western Flying Post, 25 November, 1754.
DARTMOUTH dev Glynn's Circulating Library 1830 [Amy & Eliza Glynn]
1830-44. I. Maxted, The Devon Book Trade, 1991.

Succeeded by Amy & Eliza Glynn. Imprint in G. Rowe, River Dart,[1826?].
DARTMOUTH dev Latin School 1679
Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861.

BBTI.

Took over Gore's library. I. Maxted, The Devon Book Trade, 1991.

1840-. BBTI. 1844-70. I. Maxted, The Devon Book Trade, 1991. BLC has 1858 imprint - 12809.aa.5.
DEVONPORT dev Byers' Circulating Library 1820? [William Byers]
Still there in 1850. Lattimore, 1982. BLC has several imprints.
DEVONPORT dev Civil & Military Society 1824
I. Maxted, The Devon Book Trade, 1991. Merged with Mechanics' Institution. Accounts & Papers. 1852-53. Education. 1854. Based on 1851 Census. Over 5,600 vols.
DEVONPORT dev Cohen's Circulating Library 1814? [- Cohen]
M.I. Lattimore, History of Libraries in Plymouth, London PhD Thesis, 1982.
DEVONPORT dev Colman's Circulating Library 1828? [William Colman]
I. Maxted, The Devon Book Trade, 1991. Listed in White's Devonshire Directory, 1850. BLC has several imprints 1828-42.
DEVONPORT dev Colman's Reading Room 1840 [William Colman]
I. Maxted, The Devon Book Trade, 1991.
DEVONPORT dev Congdon & Hearle's Circulating Library 1824? [Lazarus Congdon & George W. Hearle]
Lattimore, 1982. BLC has 1825 and 1828 imprints.

Lattimore, 1982.

Defunct in 1846? Devonport Mechanics' Institution

Subscribers' list, R. Wright, Review of the Missionary Life, 1824.

Subscribers' list, T.H. Williams, Picturesque Excursion, 1804. May be the same as the Dock Minerva Society.

Subscribers' list, T.H. Williams, Picturesque Tour, 1804. Still going in 1827.

Label in John Johnson. Died 1832. Listed in Pigot's National Commercial Directory 1830. BLC has 1824 imprint - 1578/6487.

BBTI. Son of William Curson.

BBTI. BLC has imprints 1805-28.

I. Maxted, The Devon Book Trade, 1991. Listed in Pigot's National Commercial Directory 1830. Exeter Flying Post, 10 July, 1823.
SIDMOUTH dev Harvey's Circulating Library 1835? [John Harvey]
I. Maxted, The Devon Book Trade, 1991. Listed in Pigot's National Commercial Directory 1830. Took over Wallis' Marine Library by 1840.
SIDMOUTH dev Hoyte's Circulating Library 1844 [William S. Hoyte]
I. Maxted, The Devon Book Trade, 1991.
SIDMOUTH dev Marsh's Circulating Library 1816? [John Marsh]
BBTI. Succeeded Miss Rose. Bankrupt in 1819?
SIDMOUTH dev Rose's Circulating Library 1812 [Miss Rose]
Succeeded by John Marsh in 1816.
SIDMOUTH dev Royal Library 1823? [John Marsh]
I. Maxted, The Devon Book Trade, 1991. Listed in Pigot's National Commercial Directory 1830
SIDMOUTH dev Subscription Library 1844
I. Maxted, The Devon Book Trade, 1991.
SIDMOUTH dev Wallis' Circulating Library 1806 [John Wallis]
Marine Library from 1809. I. Maxted, The Devon Book Trade, 1991.
SIDMOUTH dev Wallis' Marine Library 1809 [John Wallis]
I. Maxted, The Devon Book Trade, 1991. Advertised for sale in 1829. Exeter Flying Post, 3 September, 1809. Sidmouth Scenery, 1816. Succeeded by John Harvey.

SPCK. All gone.

Originally at Milton Abbas. Moved in 1785. Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861.

1851 Census. Defunct by 1861?

Lasted till 1950. After 1850 known as the Literary & Scientific Institution.

Books donated by Rev. Thomas Howe. Rebuilt 1794. An Inventory of Nonconformist Chapels and Meeting Houses in South West England. HMSO, 1991.

BBTI. 1746-79. Labels in John Johnson.
DURHAM dur St Oswald Church 1710
Some at Durham University. Perkin gives 1701 as foundation date.
DURHAM dur University of Durham 1833
(Archives)
DURHAM dur Ushaw College 1800
Numerous parish libraries. Douai English College (1568-1793).

1846-47.

York Herald, 10 January, 1801. Also had a library in Darlington.

Kaufman, Libraries & their Users, 1969. J. Brewster, Parochial History ... Stockton, 1796.

1772-1819. BBTI.

Founded by John Brewster - Address ... Divinity Library, 1799. Still going in 1868.

Did not survive beyond 1840? There was also a Sunderland Mechanics' & Apprentices Institution, 1847-58.
SUNDERLAND dur Subscription Library & Literary Society 1795
- 1905. Moved to Monkwearmouth in 1801. Catalogue: 1802, 1806, 1812, 1825, 1845 (Sunderland PL, Newcastle PL). Sold in 1938 (Sunderland PL). Minutes &c. (Tyne & Wear Archives).

Records 1838-1932 (Durham RO).

Succeeded the Medical Society. Catalogue: 1820 (Newcastle PL).

Founded by Methodists. Also known as Wesleyan Library.

Ceased in 1809.

BBTI. Subscriptions lists.

C. Fell-Smith, VCH, Essex, II, pp. 501-564.
BOCKING ess Fenno's Circulating Library 1789 [John Fenno]
Chelmsford Chronicle, 6 November, 1789.
BRAINTREE ess Book Society 1798
Kaufman, Libraries & their Users, 1969. Minute books, 1856-1944 (Essex RO).
BRAINTREE ess Braintree & Bocking Literary & Mechanics' Institute 1845
Developed from the Mutual Improvement Society. Survived till recently. Listed in Kelly's Directory of the Six Home Counties, 1851. Listed in White's Essex Directory, 1848.
BRAINTREE ess Braintree & Bocking Mutual Improvement Society 1830?
Developed into the Mechanics' Institute. Started by someone called Jordan.
BRAINTREE ess Free School 1364
C. Fell-Smith, VCH, Essex, II, pp. 501-564. Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861.

Subscribers' list, C. Ekins, Naval Battles, 1824.

PO Directory, Essex, 1851. Listed in Post Office Directory of Essex, Herts, Kent, Middlesex, Surrey and Sussex, 1855.

C. Fell-Smith, VCH, Essex, II, pp. 501-564. Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861. History 1868? BL 8304.a.4(2). 1981 X529/42657.

Subscribers' list, C.E. Stewart, Collection of Trifles, 1797.

Also Rochford. PO Directory, Essex, 1845. Listed in Kelly's Directory of the Six Home Counties, 1851. Listed in White's Essex Directory, 1848. Listed in Post Office Directory of Essex, Herts, Kent, Middlesex, Surrey and Sussex, 1855.

Listed in White's Essex Directory, 1848.

Ceased in 1790. Chelmsford Chronicle, 8 October, 1790.
CHELMSFORD ess Chelmsford Subscription Reading Room 1844
- 1885. Records (Essex RO).
CHELMSFORD ess Clachar's Circulating Library 1786 [William Clachar]
BBTI. 1786-1799. Hamlyn's Thesis, 1948. ESTC imprints as bookseller 1780-99. Succeeded Charles Frost.
CHELMSFORD ess Clerical Book Club 1844
-1984. Minutes, accounts (Essex RO).
CHELMSFORD ess Copland's Circulating Library 1830? [Alfred Copland]
PO Directory, Essex, 1845.

C. Fell-Smith, VCH, Essex, II, pp. 501-564. Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861.
CHELMSFORD ess Frost's Circulating Library 1771 [Charles Frost]
BBTI. 1771-86. Hamlyn's Thesis, 1948. ESTC imprints 1773-85. Succeeded by William Clachar. Catalogue: Ipswich Journal, 12, 26 January, 1771.
CHELMSFORD ess Gray's Circulating Library 1773 [Samuel Gray]
Chelmsford Chronicle, 18 June, 1 October, 1773. Moved to Maldon.
CHELMSFORD ess Guy's Circulating Library 1819? [Henry Guy]
BBTI.
CHELMSFORD ess Hassall's Circulating Library 1760? [Lionel Hassall]
Chelmsford Chronicle, 1 November, 1765. Died 1772. Succeeded by his widow, Mary.
CHELMSFORD ess Hassall's Circulating Library 1772 [Mary Hassall]
Succeeded by Samuel Gray.
CHELMSFORD ess Kelham's Circulating Library 1805? [R.H. Kelham]
Succeeded by Richard Dewdney in 1820.
CHELMSFORD ess Literary & Mechanics' Institution 1833
Refounded in 1843. Survived till 1895. Listed in White's Essex Directory, 1848. Chelmsford PL.
CHELMSFORD ess London Road Congregational Sunday School 1808
History 1958 BL 4716.bb.20.
CHELMSFORD ess Marsden's Circulating Library 1826? [Isaac Marsden]

CHELMSFORD ess Meggy & Chalk's Circulating Library 1799 [W. Meggy & T. Chalk]

-1880. Register of books lent 1836-80 (Essex RO). Listed in White's Essex Directory, 1848.
CHELMSFORD ess St Mary's Church 1679 [Parochial Library]
Bodley has MS. catalogue (1903). Chelmsford Cathedral. 2000+ survive. N & Q, 1882,vi,15.
CHELMSFORD ess Stanes' Circulating Library 1784 [William Stanes]
Chelmsford Chronicle, 9 January, 1784. Succeeded by R.C. Stanes (son?).

Rules (Essex RO).

Subscribers' list, J. Wilson, Missionary Voyage, 1799. Might be a parochial library or a book club.

Listed in Kelly's Directory of the Six Home Counties, 1851.

SOUTHEND ess Rennison & Tarry's Circulating Library 1795? [Mrs J. Rennison & Ann Tarry]
Known as the Marine Library. By 1806+ known as the Royal Library. Catalogue: 1810 SC.752(5). Also listed as Rennison & Tarvy.

After 1793 run by Mrs Renneson & Ann Tarry. Southend Public Library.

GLOUCESTERSHIRE

ALVESTON glo Convivio-Medical Society 1768
A medical book society, founded by John Fewster. Still going in 1789. Jenner was a member.

4 survive. Perkin's list.

BRISTOL glo Bristol Library Society 1773
Took over the old City Library (<1613) in 1773. Borrowing registers for 1773-1853 exist (Bristol RO and Bristol PL). Merged with Bristol Institution in 1871. >

Succeeded B. Barry. Listed in Robson's Directory, 1842.

Bray library. All gone.

Gloucester Directory, 1820.

A.F. Leach, VCH, Gloucestershire, II, pp. 313-448.

62 survive. Perkin's list.

STROUD glo Athenaeum 1847

Listed in Robson's Directory, 1842.

Gloucester Journal, 25 April, 1768.
STROUD glo Jenner's Circulating Library 1794? [S. Jenner]
Succeeded by John Brisley in 1811. ESTC imprints 1790-99. Hamlyn's Thesis, 1948.

Closed in 1840. Cp. the Athenaeum.

Founded by Elizabeth Hodges. A.F. Leach, VCH, Gloucestershire, II, pp. 313-448.
TETBURY glo Tetbury Book Society 1805?
Kaufman, Libraries & their Users, 1969. Subs. list (1810).
TETBURY glo Wilton's Circulating Library 1790? [John Wilton]
Gloucester Journal, 31 October, 1791. Wilton was formerly at Bath; then Tewkesbury for two years.
TEWKESBURY glo Cox's Circulating Library 1790? [Thomas Cox]
Sold in 1797. Gloucester Journal, 1 May, 4 September, 1797.
TEWKESBURY glo Dyde's Circulating Library 1763? [R. Dyde]
BBTI. Possibly the Richard Dyde recorded as printer at Wotton-under-Edge?

BBTI. Label in John Johnson.

A.F. Leach, VCH, Gloucestershire, II, pp. 313-448. Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861.
TEWKESBURY glo Garrison's Circulating Library 1845? [John Garrison]
Listed in Slater's Royal National & Commercial Directory, 1850.
TEWKESBURY glo Harwood's Circulating Library 1760? [Samuel Harwood]
BBTI. Sold to John Wilton in 1788. Harwood also ran libraries in Cheltenham and Gloucester.
TEWKESBURY glo Jenner's Circulating Library 1845? [Isaac Jenner]
Listed in Slater's Royal National & Commercial Directory, 1850.

Moved from Winchester in 1807.

Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861.

Founded by Henry Perin. A.F. Leach, VCH, Hampshire, II, pp/ 251-408.

Listed in the 1849 Public Library Report (p.317) lacking authentic information. Not as yet identified.

Rules 1822 (Hampshire RO).

Originally a Chantry School. A.F. Leach, VCH, Hampshire, II, pp/ 251-408. Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861.

Survived till 1920. County Record Office Winchester.

Listed in the 1849 Public Library Report (p.317) lacking authentic information. Not yet identified.

- 1824. Huntingdon County L. Not in ESTC? Kaufman, Libraries & their Users, 1969.
HUNTINGDON hun Grammar School 1220?
C. Guy Parsloe, VCH, Huntingdonshire, II, pp. 107-119. Founded in Henry II's time. Recorded in 1570. Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861. History 1965 BL X529/5968.
HUNTINGDON hun Huntingdon Archdeaconry Library 1716?
1000+ survive. Cambridge University.
HUNTINGDON hun Jenkinson's Circulating Library 1765 [John Jenkinson]
- 1806? Succeeded by his widow, Ann.
HUNTINGDON hun Jenkinson's Circulating Library 1805? [Ann JUenkinson]
Cambridge Chronicle, 18 January, 1806.
HUNTINGDON hun Ladies' Book Society 1824?
Listed in History of Huntingdon, 1854.
HUNTINGDON hun Lady Olivia B. Sparrow's Lending Library 1830?
Listed in History of Huntingdon, 1854.
HUNTINGDON hun Lady Olivia Bernard Sparrow's Lending Library 1800?
Bookplate in Franks. Referred to as Lady Olivia Bernard Sparrow's Lending Library for Huntingdon and Godmanchester. There is also a bookplate in Franks for The Brampton Park Library - in Brampton, Lincolnshire?
HUNTINGDON hun Literary & Scientific Institution 1840
Survived till recently. Listed in Kelly's Directory of Berkshire, Northamptonshire and Oxfordshire, 1854. Listed in History of Huntingdon, 1854.
HUNTINGDON hun Literary Society 1817
- 1830. Listed in History of Huntingdon, 1854.
HUNTINGDON hun Lovell's Circulating Library 1808 [Thomas Lovell]

Cambridge Chronicle, 9 November, 1810.
HUNTINGDON hun Walden's Charity School 1719
Founded by Lionel Walden. C. Guy Parsloe, VCH, Huntingdonshire, II, pp. 107-119.

LEWISHAM ken Free Grammar School 1656 [Colfe's Grammar School]
Founded by Abraham Colfe as a free public library. Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861. Some books at Leathersellers' Hall. History 1902 BL Ac.5662/4. 1952 08364.g.77. 1910 08367.g.4. Cat. 1831. Foundation date sometimes given as 1652.

MAIDSTONE ken Vidion's Circulating Library 1803 [John M. Vidion]
-1813. Took over Jane Walker's library. Maidstone Journal, 30 August, 1803. BBTI.
MAIDSTONE ken Walker's Circulating Library 1770? [Richard Walker]
- 1779. Succeeded by his widow Jane. BBTI. Kentish Gazette, 14 October, 1775; 17 July, 1779.
MAIDSTONE ken Walker's Circulating Library 1779 [Jane Walker]
- 1803. Maidstone Journal, 30 August, 1803. Succeeded by John Vidion.
MAIDSTONE ken West's Circulating Library 1841? [William West]
BBTI.
MAIDSTONE ken Wickham's Circulating Library 1826? [Mrs Phoebe & George Wickham]
- 1874. BBTI. George was Phoebe's son. Sold to Frederick Bunyard in 1874.
MAIDSTONE ken Williams' Circulating Library 1824 [Edward Williams]
- 1826. Maidstone Journal, 5 October, 1824.
MALLING ken Malling Book Society 1780?
Subs. list (1785).
MARGATE ken Austen's Circulating Library 1785 [Charles Austen]
1785-88. Succeeded by Champion. Label in Canterbury PL. Bodley (JJ) has label for Austen & Garner's CL. Label in Canterbury PL. Hamlyn's Thesis, 1948. Margate Guide, 1785.
MARGATE ken Bettison's Circulating Library 1800 [Samuel Bettison]
Also known as the Marine Library. Still going in 1838 - Watering Places. Margate Guide (1816): "many thousand volumes".
MARGATE ken Bettison's Circulating Library 1825 [William G. Bettison]
1825-38. Marine Library label in Canterbury PL. Samuel's son. Listed in The Watering Places of Great Britain, 1833.
MARGATE ken Book Society 1750?
Defunct in 1768. Kaufman, Libraries & their Users, 1969.
MARGATE ken Book Society 1833
Different from the earlier one. Kelde's Companion to the Alamanacks, 1852.
MARGATE ken Bousfield & Pallister's Circulating Library 1809 [Thomas Bousfield & Thomas Pallister]
1809-15. Succeeded Silver. Label in Canterbury PL.
MARGATE ken Bousfield's Circulating Library 1809? [Bousfield & Co.]
BBTI.
MARGATE ken Brown's Circulating Library 1830 [Cornelius Brown]
1830-36. Succeeded Lubbock. Moved to Maidstone in 1836. Succeeded by Vaughan. Listed in The Watering Places of Great Britain, 1833.
MARGATE ken Burgess' Circulating Library 1785? [Peter Burgess]
Briefly in Margate, then moved to Ramsgate. Hamlyn's Thesis, 1948. Margate Guide, 1785.
MARGATE ken Burgess' Circulating Library 1817 [John O. Burgess]
Son of Peter Burgess.
MARGATE ken Burgess' Musical Circulating Library 1822? [Peter Burgess]
Label in John Johnson.
MARGATE ken Champion & Garner's Circulating Library 1789 [? Champion & William Garner]
Label in John Johnson.

- 1795. John Johnson has label Champion & Garner. Hamlyn's Thesis, 1948.

1817-53. BBTI. Cat.[1840?] (Margate PL).

1835-55. D. Knott, The Book Trade in Kent (Thanet), 1989.
MARGATE ken Garner's Circulating Library 1779? [William Garner]
1779-1824. Succeeded by Bettison. D. Knott, The Book Trade in Kent (Thanet), 1989. Cp. entry for Champion. Hamlyn's Thesis, 1948. Short Description ... Thanet, 1796. Factotum, xvi, 1983, pp. 16-18. Label in Franks.
MARGATE ken Hale's Circulating Library 1840? [Robert Hale]
BBTI.
MARGATE ken Hall's Circulating Library 1766 [Joseph Hall]
1766-95. Kentish Post, 29 January, 1766. D. Knott, The Book Trade in Kent (Thanet), 1989. 1770 imprint in 11643.e.48(2). New library built in 1786 - later occupied by Were then Bettison. Margate Guide, 1816.
MARGATE ken Johnson's Circulating Library 1820? [- Johnson]
- 1825. Succeeded Parkyns.

RAMSGATE ken Witherden's Circulating Library 1794 [Ann Witherden]
1794-1819. D. Knott, The Book Trade in Kent (Thanet), 1989. G. Witherden was a printer in Margate. Spelled as "Withenden" in some sources. Hamlyn's Thesis, 1948. Margate Guide, 1816. She also had a boarding house. Short Description ... Thanet, 1796.

TONBRIDGE ken Sprange's Circulating Library 1780? [Jasper Sprange]
Sprange ran his main library at Tunbridge Wells. Cp. Stidolph.
TONBRIDGE ken Stidolph's Circulating Library 1786? [George Stidolph]
BBTI.
TUNBRIDGE WELLS ken Baker's Circulating Library 1770? [Edmund Baker]
Died 1774. Also referred to as Edward. Succeeded by Jasper Sprange. ESTC imprints from 1754. Hamlyn's Thesis, 1948. Fire in 1761. MS Catalogue: in Sprange's had in Tunbridge Wells Museum, dated 1773. Not clear when the Tunbridge Wells branch was opened.
TUNBRIDGE WELLS ken Baldock's Circulating Library 1803? [William Baldock]
- 1814.
TUNBRIDGE WELLS ken Brooks' Circulating Library 1847? [William Brooks]
Listed in Kelly's Directory of the Six Home Counties, 1851.

H. Burrows]
- 1843. Colbran's Tunbridge Wells Guide,[1843?]
TUNBRIDGE WELLS ken Colbran's Circulating Library 1850? [H.S. Colbran]
Listed in Post Office Directory of Essex, Herts, Kent, Middlesex, Surrey and Sussex, 1855.
TUNBRIDGE WELLS ken Colbran's Circulating Library 1850? [John Colbran]
Listed in Kelly's Directory of the Six Home Counties, 1851. Listed in Post Office Directory of Essex, Herts, Kent, Middlesex, Surrey and Sussex, 1855.

LANCASHIRE

ACCRINGTON lan Mechanics' Institute 1845
Survived till recently.
ACCRINGTON lan New Jerusalem Sunday School 1830?
Rules for the Sick Society - 1835: 3716.l.9(3). Part of the New Church Society.
ACCRINGTON lan Parochial Library 1818
A Bray library. None left.
ACCRINGTON lan Subscription Library 1795?
Label in 1795 book in Glasgow UL - also subs. list in vol. 4. 
ADMARSH lan Parochial Library 1757
Bray library. Further funds in 1835. All gone.
AINSWORTH lan Parochial Library 1838
A Bray library.
AINSWORTH lan Presbyterian Chapel 1718
Few books survive? An Inventory of Nonconformist Chapels and Meeting Houses in the North of England. HMSO, 1994.

Schools Inquiry Commission, 1867-68.

Survived till 1901. Accounts &c. 1825-1901 (Tameside Archives).

There was a Church & King Club started in 1794. Ceased in 1855. Catalogue: 1837, 1841 (Bolton PL).
BOLTON lan Exchange News Room 1824
Started in 1813, library added in 1824. Bolton Express, 6 March; 8 May, 1824.

A.F. Leach, VCH, Lancashire, II, pp. 561-624.

Schools Inquiry Commission, 1867-68.

A free library. Sold in 1958 to the Methodists. An Inventory of Nonconformist Chapels and Meeting Houses in the North of England. HMSO, 1994.

WESTMINSTER msx Fearman's Circulating Library 1815? [William Fearman]

WESTMINSTER msx Noble's Circulating Library 1745 [John & Francis Noble]
Cat 1755? Bodley Don.e.207(1). BL has xerox 1600/1471. Catalogue: 1761 ESTC. Library History, viii, 3, p. 75. Harvard's copy of the novel 'Twas wrong to marry him (ESTC n014103) has a 15 page "Appeal to the public" - a defence of their publications and their circulating libraries. Date = 1773. General Advertiser, 14 May 1745. McKillop p. 483. Cp. ESTC t204463 - sep. pub. "Appeal" - NL C.107.e.58.
WESTMINSTER msx Noble's Circulating Library 1766 [Samuel Noble]
Hamlyn's Thesis, 1948.
WESTMINSTER msx Ollier's Circulating Library 1820? [Charles & James Ollier]
Charles & James Ollier were publishers between 1817 and 1822. Charles is known in an imprint of 1849 - Charlton Carew's The Poacher's Wife - N.2624. Pigot, 1823. The Olliers published Shelley, Leigh Hunt, Lamb, Keats, &c.
WESTMINSTER msx Onwhyn's Circulating Libraryary 1820? [Joseph Onwhyn]
BBTI. Label in Heal.
WESTMINSTER msx Pannier's Foreign & English Circulating Library 1810? [N.L. Pannier]
Catalogue: 1812 11900.b.34. Label in Banks. French books as well as English.

Succeeded Dangerfield. Leigh's New Picture of London, 1818. Hamlyn's Thesis, 1948. Moved to Mount Street from Berkeley Square in 1818. Succeeded by Scripps > Day.

- 1801. Cp. Cooke's Circulating Library. Imprint in ESTC. Hamlyn's Thesis, 1948.

WESTMINSTER msx Rolandi's Circulating Library 1825? [Peter Rolandi]
- 1880. Post Office London Directory, 1850. Listed in Robson's London Directory, 1842. Catalogue: 1849 1119118.pp.19. Specialising in Italian, Spanish and Portuguese books.

WESTMINSTER msx St Martin's-in-the-Fields[Parochial] Library 1684
Founded by Archbishop Tenison as a free public library. Dispersed. MS Catalogue: (Lambeth Palace). Peter Hoare. Thesis. UCL. Edmund Gibson published Catalogue: of MSS in 1691.
WESTMINSTER msx Stodart's Circulating Library 1815? [Robert Stodart]
Also known as the Strand Circulating Library. Leigh's New Picture of London, 1818.
WESTMINSTER msx Swift's Circulating Library 1774 [William T. Swift]
- 1786. rint in 12612.g.16. 1782 imprint in ESTC. Hamlyn's Thesis, 1948. Lasted till 1785.
WESTMINSTER msx Taylor's Circulating Library 1745 [Thomas Taylor]
Penny London Post, 1-3 Jan. 1746. McKillop p. 483. Catalogue: Library History, viii,3, p. 75.
WESTMINSTER msx United Service Club 1815?
1815 bookplate in Franks.
WESTMINSTER msx Vandenburgh's Circulating Library 1772? [Simon Vandenburgh]
- 1779. Known as the Philoboiblion Library.
