Johnstone's London Guide, 1818.
WESTMINSTER msx Western Union Cooperative Society 1830
Third Cooperative Congress, London, 23 April, 1832. 50 vols.
WESTMINSTER msx Westminster Literary Society 1791
Also known as the Westminster Library. - 1821. Catalogue: 1803 (Westminster PL). Sale Catalogue: 1821 (BL). K. Manley, Library, 1985.
WESTMINSTER msx Westminster Medical Library 1800?
Picture of London, 1803.
WESTMINSTER msx Westminster Medical Subscription Library 1785?
Times, 18 March, 1789.
WESTMINSTER msx Westminster School 1560 [St Peter's College]
History 1816 BL - 732.l.27. 1934 8368.k.10. Bookplates in Franks, including one 17c. Includes Richard Busby's library (1695) of which some 350 remain.
WESTMINSTER msx Wheatstone's Musical Circulating Library 1805? [Charles Wheatstone]
- 1827. Holden, 1805.
WESTMINSTER msx White's Circulating Library 1795? [Thomas White]
- 1811. BBTI.
WESTMINSTER msx Wilcox's Circulating Library 1751 [Thomas Wilcox]
Hamlyn's Thesis, 1948.
WESTMINSTER msx Williams' Circulating Library 1805? [Michael Williams]
Holden, 1805.
WESTMINSTER msx Wright's Entertaining[Circulating] Library 1741 [Thomas Wright]
Cat.[1750?] - Bodley. Daily Advertiser, 16 June 1741. Later called the Universal Circulating Library. McKillop p. 483. Library History, viii,3, p. 75. Succeeded by Batho > Bell > Cawthorn. Known as The British Library to 1913. N & Q, 1937, Mar. 13, 190.
WHITECHAPEL msx Davenant's Grammar School 1680
Founded by Ralph Davenant. J.D. Mellor, VCH, Middlesex, I, pp. 290-314.

WHITECHAPEL msx Lane's Minerva Library 1770 [William Lane]
1770-1775. Moved to Leadenhall Street 1802. Furnished circulating libraries. Blakey, 1939. Catalogue: dated[1797] by ESTC (t189724).
WHITECHAPEL msx Milburn's Circulating Library 1825? [Susanna Milburn]
Listed in Pigot's London & Provincial New Commercial Directory for 1826-7 .
WHITECHAPEL msx St George's Lutheran Church 1762 [Parochial Library]
The library is now in the British Library. Formed principally from the collection of the Church's first pastor Peter G.A. Wachsel (d. 1799). Includes books from August Francke's Frankesche Stiftungen, founded in 1698. See: www.bl.uk/collections/epc/georex10.html
WHITECHAPEL msx Sion Chapel Sunday School 1815?
Cp. Milk for Babes, 1818 - 1111.a.33.

Pigot, 1823.

Holden, 1811.
WHITECHAPEL msx Whitechapel Book Society 1815?
Subs. list (1819).

PETERBOROUGH noh Peterborough Gentleman's Society 1730
Founded by Rev. Timothy Neve. - 1900. Books and accounts in Peterborough PL. According to Brian Hubber (State L of Victoria, Melbourne) the club met in the bookshop of  G. Knapp in Peterborough. Note: B. Hubber, Bulletin of Bib. Soc. A/NZ, 1997, No. 4, on a MS circulation list in the National Library of Australia (Belloy's The Siege of Calais, 1765). By then the Society had become an ordinary book club.

Short lived?

Staffordshire Advertiser, 12 May, 1821.

History 1954 BL - X520/9457.

1851 Census.

Listed in White's Staffordshire Directory, 1850.

WALSALL sta Subscription Library & News Room 1801
- 1835. Founded by Rev. Thomas Bowen. Merged with Literary & Philosophical Institution by 1841. Listed in White's Directory of Staffordshire, 1851. Accounts in Walsall PL.

Subs. list. Kaufman, Libraries & their Users, 1969.

Listed in White's Staffordshire Directory, 1850. Nall's Circulating Library

Survived till 1877.

- 1797. > James Barry. Hamlyn's Thesis, 1948. Subscription list to Thomas Anburey's travels, 1789.

- 1975. Catalogue: 1798, 1807, 1822, 1838, 1849 (Birmingham PL). Listed in Slater's Directory of Scotland, 1852. Charles Parish, FLA Thesis. 1964; as History, published in 1966. Priestley's Address, 1787 - ESTC.

- 1831.

- 1843. In 1844 books bought by the Birmingham Library.

For dissenters. Merged with Birmingham Library in 1860. Catalogue: 1815, 1826, 1836, 1844, 1854 (Birmingham PL).

DONCASTER yor Bisby's Circulating Library 1798? [Miss Frances Bisby]
BBTI. Listed in Baines' Yorkshire Directory, 1822. Listed in Pigot's Commercial Directory for 1822-23
DONCASTER yor Boys & Sheardown's Circulating Library 1789 [Dickinson Boys & William Sheardown]
- 1792.
DONCASTER yor Doncaster Society Library 1714 [St George's Subscription Library]
Listed by Perkins as a parochial library. Started as the Clergymen's Society. A clerical subscription library. Several hundred volumes in 1726. Fire in 1853. Catalogue: 1821. Records in Doncaster Archives.
DONCASTER yor Doncaster Subscription Library 1821
- 1868. Became the Public Library. Catalogue: 1829 - BL 1609/4549. Ceased in 1869.
DONCASTER yor Franklinian Institution 1850
DONCASTER yor Grammar School 1350?
A.F. Leach, VCH, Yorkshire, I, pp. 415-500. Crockford's Scholastic Directory for 1861.

Listed in White's Directory of Hull, 1851.
DONCASTER yor Lyceum 1834
Closed in 1844.
DONCASTER yor Mechanics' Institute 1826
1851 Census. Ceased in 1869. Now in Free Library founded in 1869.

BBTI. Advert. in Bodley. ESTC. Woollen took over Northall's library, but had another one (1794-) known as the British Circulating Library. Catalogue: 1806 (Sheffield PL). Also known as Woollen's British Circulating Library.
